intro: Peiranisia salvadorensis, commonly known as the Salvadoran peiranisia, is a rare flowering plant native to El Salvador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
